message.content:
cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.CV 

This paper is about improving the quality and diversity of recommendations in content recommender systems using a real-time attention based look-alike model. The paper focuses on optimizing user representation learning and look-alike learning modeling, which are key areas in information retrieval (cs.IR) and machine learning (cs.LG). The proposed model also uses attention mechanisms, which are commonly used in natural language processing (cs.CL) and computer vision (cs.CV) tasks. Additionally, the paper discusses the impact of lacking behavior features on recommendations, which is a problem that can be addressed using social influence (cs.SI) techniques. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CV, and cs.SI.
